name: other
posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

dsense.name: other
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

trans_examp.trans_en: as well as the thing or person already mentioned

example.eg: The product has many other time-saving features.
example.egtrans: 该产品还有许多其他的省时特性。

example.eg: There is no other work available at the moment.
example.egtrans: 眼下没有其他的活儿了。

example.eg: There is only one other person who could help us.
example.egtrans: 只有另外一个人可以帮助我们。

example.eg: Are there any other people we should ask?
example.egtrans: 另外还有我们应该问的人吗？

example.eg: I found one earring - do you know where the other one is?
example.egtrans: 我找到了一只耳环——你知道另一只在哪儿吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: used at the end of a list to show that there are more things, without being exact about what they are

example.eg: The plan has been opposed by schools, businesses and other local organizations.
example.egtrans: 该计划遭到了学校、企业及其他当地组织的反对。

example.eg: These two books will be especially useful for editors, journalists and other professional users of the language.
example.egtrans: 这两本书将对编辑、记者及其他使用该语言的专业人士尤为有用。

dsense.name: other
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the opposite side or end of something

example.eg: Put the chair at the other end of the desk.
example.egtrans: 把椅子放到桌子的另一边去。

example.eg: The man was waiting on the other side of the street.
example.egtrans: 那个人在街对面等着。

dsense.name: other
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

trans_examp.trans_en: different from the thing or person already mentioned

example.eg: Idon't have any cash - is there no other way of paying?
example.egtrans: 我没有现金——没有其他支付方式吗？

example.eg: He likes travelling abroad and learning about other people's customs and traditions.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢到国外去旅行，并了解其他民族的风俗习惯。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: referring to a day, week, etc. in the recent past without saying exactly when it was
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （指最近某个大概的时间）那天/那个星期（等等）

example.eg: I saw him just the other day/night.
example.egtrans: 我那天／那天晚上刚见过他。

example.eg: Cruises other than the ones listed below are not discounted at this time.
example.egtrans: 除了下面列出的乘船游览项目以外，其他项目没有折扣。

example.eg: The form cannot be signed by anyone other than yourself.
example.egtrans: 除了你本人，谁也不能在这张表格上签字。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in a negative sentence, used to mean "except"

example.eg: There's nothing on TV tonight, other than the usual rubbish.
example.egtrans: 今晚的电视除了惯常的垃圾，再没别的了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to introduce an explanation that is simpler than the one given earlier

example.eg: He was economical with the truth - in other words, he was lying.
example.egtrans: 他没讲多少实话——换言之，他在撒谎。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used when you cannot or do not want to be exact about the information you are giving

example.eg: The event was held in some park or other.
example.egtrans: 这个活动是在某个公园举行的。

example.eg: We'll find someone or other to help us.
example.egtrans: 我们会找个人来帮我们的。

name: other
posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: the second of two things or people, or the thing or person that is left in a group or set of things
trans_examp.trans_cn: （两者中的）另一个，第二个；（一组或一套中的）另一个

example.eg: Hold the racquet in one hand and the ball in the other.
example.egtrans: 一只手握拍，另一只手持球。

example.eg: Some people prefer a vegetarian diet, while others prefer a meat-based diet.
example.egtrans: 有的人偏爱素食，而另一些人偏爱肉食。

example.eg: She gave me one book last week and promised to bring the others on Wednesday.
example.egtrans: 上周她给了我一本书，并答应周三把其他的书带来。

example.eg: I only know about this book, but there might be others (= other books).
example.egtrans: 我只知道这本书，不过或许还有别的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: people in general, not including yourself

example.eg: You shouldn't expect others to do your work for you.
example.egtrans: 你不应该指望别人替你干活儿。
